title.narrative: INCLUSIVE QUALITY EDUCATION

description.narrative: By 2022, the Ministry of Education has strategies, tools and models to improve the provision of quality inclusive pre-primary, primary and secondary education services with a culturally relevant and risk management approach., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, mothers, children, adolescents and families, especially the most vulnerable (on the northern border, indigenous peoples, Afrodescendants and others) and/or in emergency situations, exercise their right to health, education, water and sanitation and to informed and effective participation, with a focus on early childhood and adolescence

participating-org.narrative: FACULTAD LATINOAMERICANA DE CIENCIAS SOCIALES FLACSO
INSTITUTO IBEROAMERICANO DEL PATRIM NATURAL Y CULTURAL IPANC DE LA ORGANIZACION DEL CONVENIO ANDRES BE

mailing-address.narrative: Av. Amazonas 2889 y La Granja Edificio Naciones Unidas Quito

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening - inclusive education for other vulnerable children poorest quintile, ethnic/linguistic minorities, migrant children, non-citizens/undocumented children etc.
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the Ministry of Education has strategies, tools and models to improve the provision of quality inclusive pre-primary,primary and secondary education services with a culturally relevant and risk management approach.

description.narrative: UNICEF CO has strengthened educational policies that promote educational inclusion. A Rural and Community Education Model is being developed that promotes a pedagogical model designed from the local to the national level, rescuing all the lessons learned from the pandemic, where educational processes must be contextualized and built with the entire educational community. Additionally, 4.3 million students, 206,000 teachers and 3,165 DECE professionals are permanently monitored to identify their educational continuity needs generated by COVID 19. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:18/01/2022

title.narrative: Public institutions count with shared policies for flexible educational offers, which includes the necessary adjustments to the current normative, the organic structure and budget estimations(67174)

baseline.value: Programs are operating under inadequate normatives, insuffient funding and under-trained staff.

target.value: 2022:The program for flexible educational offers counts with a policy costing, a normative proposal and training proposal.
